Comments_List: I learned how to calculate limits, derivatives, integrals, and an assortment of other skills that are foundational to calculus.

I was able to learn about the real calculus which I was not able to take it in my senior year. Even though the course was really challenging for me since I only took until pre-calculus, I tried my best to keep up with the concepts every class. I spend a lot of time outside of class and used many different type of sources to understand better about the concept. As a result, I was able to learn about the derivative and integral, and after the course, I was even able to help my friends on their AP Calculus.
Its strengths are its teaching but the homework was overwhelming, felt like having homework due the day of exams was unnecessary.
I would since the skills taught in this course are very useful for not only mathematics courses but also an array of other courses as well.

Yes, it is one of the way to learn about the calculus without taking it in high school. I think it is the best course that students can choose if they are not selected for the AP Calculus  at their school.
